clinical_study.brief_title: Fibre-optic Guided Tracheal Intubation Through SADs
clinical_study.official_title: Fibre-optic Guided Tracheal Intubation Through Supraglottic Airway Devices - a Randomised Comparison Between I-gel and the LMA ProtectorTM

lead_sponsor.agency: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

clinical_study.source: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to establish which of the two second generation Supraglottic Airway Devices, the I-gel or the the laryngeal ask airway (LMA) Protector, is best suited to be used as a conduit to fibreoptic bronchoscope assisted tracheal intubation. The primary outcome of this will be the time to complete the tracheal intubation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Tracheal intubation through a supraglottic airway device (SAD) is a well-established technique in the management of patients with a difficult airway. The technique can be used in patients in whom difficult intubation is expected, or in situations when tracheal intubation using another method was not possible. It is now recommended that tracheal intubation through the SAD should be performed using a fibreoptic scope (a camera device) to minimise the risk of trauma to the airway, and that second generation SADs are used to minimise the risk of aspiration of gastric contents.
There are two second generation SADs currently available which allow tracheal intubation: the I-gel and the LMA protector.
The I-gel is a second generation supraglottic airway device widely used in anaesthesia and resuscitation. Fibreoptic intubation through the I-gel has been evaluated in a recent prospective study (1), with the first attempt success rate of 91.4%. In another study (2) of patients with predicted difficult airway, the success rate of the procedure at first attempt was 96%.
LMA Protector is a recently introduced, improved version the LMA supreme - another second generation SAD. LMA supreme has been used in clinical practice for more than 10 years, however, tracheal intubation through the device was extremely difficult because of the small size of the breathing channel. The LMA Protector, has a larger breathing channel allowing the passage of an endotracheal tube. Compared to the I-gel, is has also got a larger gastric drainage tube. This allows easy suction in the event of regurgitation. Therefore, it appears to be superior to the I-gel in preventing the aspiration. But there are no studies comparing the ease of intubation through I-gel and LMA Protector
The aim of this study is to compare the ease of performing the fibreoptic guided tracheal intubation through these two devices. Our hypothesis is that intubation through the I-gel is easier and quicker.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Intubation Time to Perform Fibreoptic Intubation
primary_outcome.description: Time form insertion of bronchoscope through the supraglottic airway device to obtaining the capnography trace

secondary_outcome.description: Time taken to insert the supra-glottic airway device measured from insertion into the mouth until the capnography trace is obtained

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Attempts at the SAD Placement
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts taken to successfully place the supraglottic airway device in the oropharynx

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Ease of Placement of the SAD
secondary_outcome.description: The ease of placement of the SAD assessed by the investigator on a four point scale: - Easy - Moderate Difficulty 3- Severe Difficulty 4 - Failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With First and Second Attempt at Tracheal Intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts at tracheal intubation. A new attempt is defined as re-insertion of the fibreoptic bronchoscope through the SAD.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Quality of the View of the Vocal Cords Seen Through the SAD
secondary_outcome.description: The quality of the view of the vocal cords seen through the SAD. It will be assessed, according to the previously published system, as: grade I - full view of the vocal cord, II - partial view of the vocal cords including arytenoids, III - epiglottis only, IV - other (SAD cuff, pharynx, others)
The time from insertion of fibreoptic scope into the lumen of the SAD to the visualization of the carina.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Type of Airway Maneuvers Performed During Tracheal Intubation,
secondary_outcome.description: The number of tube rotations performed during tracheal intubation

arm_group.description: Fibreoptic guided tracheal intubation through I-gel
Fibreoptic guided tracheal intubation through Protector

intervention.description: Fibreoptic guided tracheal intubation is going to be performed through the I-gel supraglottic airway.
Fibreoptic guided tracheal intubation is going to be performed through the LMA Protector supraglottic airway.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
â€¢ All patients aged above 18, presenting for elective surgical procedure, where a supraglottic airway device can be used and left in place throughout the duration of surgery and requiring tracheal intubation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are do not wish to take part
- Patients with class II obesity (BMI >40)
- Patients below 18 years of age
- American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA 3, 4 and 5)
- Patients with mouth opening of less than 3 cm
- Patients deemed to require awake intubation
- Surgery involving head and neck region
- Surgery requiring prone position

British Thoracic Society guideline for diagnostic flexible bronchoscopy in adults: accredited by NICE. Thorax. 2013 Aug;68 Suppl 1:i1-i44. doi: 10.1136/thoraxjnl-2013-203618.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Total Intubation Time to Perform Fibreoptic Intubation
outcome.description: Time form insertion of bronchoscope through the supraglottic airway device to obtaining the capnography trace
outcome.population: In 2 patients randomly allocated to the LMA Protector group due to the failure insertion of the LMA protector the i-gel was used instead. 2 patients randomised to the LMA protector group underwent direct laryngoscopy and tracheal intubation; one due to failed insertion of both devices and one due to the failed fibreopitc-guided tracheal intubation

reported_events.desc: In two patients randomly allocated to the LMA protector group, due to failed insertion of LMA protector the I-GEL was used instead In two patients allocated to the LMA protector group, due to failed intubation direct laryngoscopy was performed. Therefore; the final number in I-GEL group is 92 and LMA Protector Group is 86(2 were allocated to I-GEL and 2 completely failed)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
